meanings.definition: Large globular proteins found in the blood.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that macroglobulins are big proteins in the blood.
meanings.sent2: The lab results showed high levels of macroglobulins in the patient's blood.
meanings.sent3: The macroglobulins in the blood were having a party, bouncing around happily.
meanings.sent4: Her bloodstream was a galaxy of macroglobulins, each one a shining star.
meanings.sent5: The macroglobulins floated like fluffy clouds in the crimson river of blood.

meanings.sent1: The scientist studied how macroglobulins help fight infections.
meanings.sent2: The macroglobulins in his body reacted quickly to the virus.
meanings.sent3: The macroglobulins high-fived each other for successfully defeating the germs.
meanings.sent4: Her immune system was an army of macroglobulins, ready to defend her health.
meanings.sent5: The macroglobulins stood guard like vigilant soldiers against any intruders.
